title: Provides an exemption of fifty percent of a retired military employee's retirement allowance if such person has been employed, on average, twenty-five hours per wee
summary: Provides an exemption of fifty percent of a retired military employee's retirement allowance if such person has been employed, on average, twenty-five hours per week.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1392

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. ORTIZ, BENEDETTO -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of
         A. HOOPER -- read once and referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

       AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to tax exemptions  for  certain
         retired military personnel

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subsection (c) of section 612 of the tax law is amended  by
    2  adding a new paragraph 39 to read as follows:
    3    (39)  AN  AMOUNT  EQUAL TO FIFTY PERCENT OF MONEY RECEIVED PURSUANT TO
    4  SECTION TWO HUNDRED FIFTEEN OF THE MILITARY LAW BY A  TAXPAYER  FOR  ANY
    5  TAXABLE  YEAR  IN  WHICH  THE  TAXPAYER HAS BEEN EMPLOYED, ON AVERAGE, A
    6  MINIMUM OF TWENTY-FIVE HOURS PER WEEK.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately and  shall  apply  to  any
    8  taxable year commencing after such effective date.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04014-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to tax exemptions for certain retired military personnel
